casebody.data:
The State ex rel. Jackson, Appellant, v. Lanzinger, Judge, Appellee.

[Cite as State ex rel. Jackson v. Lanzinger (1992), 65 Ohio St.3d 132.]

(No. 91-2266 — Submitted October 13, 1992 — Decided November 18, 1992.) James L. Jackson, pro se. Anthony G. Pizza, Prosecuting Attorney, and Michael C. Mota, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellee.

*133The cause is affirmed for the reason stated in the court of appeals’ opinion which denied appellant’s complaint in mandamus for a copy of the transcript of his trial proceedings that “a true and accurate copy of the transcript of proceedings was [already] provided” to him.

Moyer, C.J., Sweeney, Holmes, Douglas, Wright, H. Brown and Resnick, JJ., concur.
